active_learning.discussion_prompt: Debate the trade-offs between rapid incident response and strict adherence to chain of custody in a live cyberattack scenario (e.g., ransomware), referencing NIST SP 800-61 Rev. 3 phases. How might this impact legal outcomes and evidence admissibility? Consider real-world priorities and common misconceptions that forensics is purely post-incident.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

distractor_protocol.step: Identify common misconceptions about the topic
Ensure distractors are similar in length and complexity
Include partial truths that require deeper understanding

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in university-level pedagogy (Bloom's Taxonomy, active learning, scaffolding). Generate 50 high-quality flashcards on 'Forensic Investigation' (Topic Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > 002_Incident Response And Forensics > 002_Incident Response Team Organization > 003_Roles and Responsibilities > Operational Responsibilities > Forensic Investigation). Incorporate: - Learning Objectives: [Insert full list from above]. - Scaffolding Layers: [Insert full scaffolding from above]; allocate ~12-13 cards per layer. - Active Learning: Tie explanations to discussion/peer teaching/problem-solving where relevant. - Research Context: NIST SP 800-61 Rev. 3 (IR phases), NIST SP 800-86 (forensics: Identification/Preservation/Collection/Examination/Analysis/Presentation); definitions from SentinelOne/IBM; chain of custody critical for legal. - Prior Knowledge: Builds on NIST SP 800-61 Preparation/Detection. Use Flashcard Schema exactly: - MCQ/Cloze: Front=Question+4 options; Back={correct_answer, explanation (link to objective/layer/NIST), distractors_explained, related_objective, active_learning_link}. - Distractors: Plausible (semantic/conceptual/extreme) based on misconceptions (e.g., forensics=only post-incident). Output as JSON array of objects: [{'front': '...', 'back': {...}}, ...]. Ensure comprehensive coverage, measurable progression, and hyperlinks to sources (e.g., https://nvlpubs.nist.gov/nistpubs/SpecialPublications/NIST.SP.800-86.pdf).
